text: A biological neuron is a specialized cell found in the nervous system of living organisms, including humans. It is the fundamental building block of the nervous system and is responsible for transmitting and processing electrical signals, known as nerve impulses. Neurons have a cell body, dendrites that receive signals, an axon that transmits signals, and synapses that allow communication with other neurons. They play a crucial role in functions such as sensation, movement, and cognition.
